title: reference request - What kind of null set is this?
body: Let $H$ be a Hilbert space. Suppose the following holds: for every orthonormal basis $\{e_n\}$ of $H$ and sequence $\{\epsilon_n\} \in \ell^2(\mathbb{N})$ , with $C:= \prod_n [-\epsilon_n e_n, \epsilon_n e_n ]$ , if $\nu$ denotes the product measure $dx/2\epsilon_n$ , then $\nu((H\backslash A) \cap C) = 0$ . Then $H\backslash A$ is called a negligible set. Is there a technical term for this type of set? I want to know more details about it but no clue what to search for.
